title: Good in Bed Guide to Overcoming Premature Ejaculation
description:
Good in Bed Guide to Overcoming Premature Ejaculation by: Ian Kerner PhD
Good in Bed Guides (July 15, 2010) | ISBN: ? | 538 pages | PDF | 10 MB

From the New York Times best-selling author of She Comes First arrives the definitive guide to managing premature ejaculation â€“ a book that could save your sex life!

Do you suffer from PE? Are you unable to control when you ejaculate? Do you ejaculate within a minute or less of starting intercourse or even during foreplay? Have you tried various methods to deal with PE, only to have your hopes dashed?Do you avoid intimate situations because they could lead to premature ejaculationâ€”so why even bother? Do the words â€œstop-startâ€ and â€œsqueezeâ€ make you want to scream?

If you answered â€œyesâ€ to these questions, you could have chronic PEâ€”and youâ€™re not alone. PE is the most common type of sexual dysfunction a man can have, with many experts estimating that up to 30 percent of all men suffer from it. 

But now, with new research and a new scientific understanding of PE, comes new techniques and new approaches. The program detailed in this book combines the best of behavioral, medical, and interpersonal modalities.

Ian Kerner, Ph.D, is a sex and relationships counselor and New York Times best-selling author of numerous books for Harper Collins, including â€œShe Comes Firstâ€ and â€œLove in the Time of Colic.â€ His journey to counseling grew out of his own personal battle with sexual dysfunction and his desire to help others. He often addresses issues that are common to the â€œAmerican bedroomâ€ but nonetheless lead to lives of quiet desperation. Ian is a contributor to NBC TODAY, amongst others, and lives his wife and two boys in New York City where he maintains a private practice
